title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.16.34-36 | 11-02-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Chakshuron Meelitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Prishtaya Bhutale
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadhadhara Shri Vasadi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udhirayet
In this session we are discussing from 3 verses 34, 35 and 36.
The last 3 verses are from 3 verses 34, 35 and 36.
The last 3 verses of this chapter, 16th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavata.
So these verses are all given separately.
So one verse at a time.
Mother Earth is addressing the personality of religious principles, Dharma.
Burdened by the undue military phalanxes arranged by Atheistic Kings.
And I was relieved by the grace of the Personality of Godhead.
By the grace of the Supreme Lord, all those military phalanxes were destroyed of the Atheistic Kings.
Similarly, you are also in a distressed condition, weakened in your standing strength, and thus
he also incarnated by his internal energy in the family of the Yadus to relieve you.
So Krishna's appearance, one of the reasons for his appearance is to reduce the burden
of the Earth which is overburdened by demoniac persons posing as Kshatriyas.
To properly rule this Earth planet, or to rule some provinces or states, they don't
So they simply pose as if they are independently able to do the administration without any
They take charge or control of the whole state or province or country or whatever, and they
create havoc in the lives of ordinary people.
So, to curtail these people's miscreant activities, the Lord incarnated as Krishna, and he incarnated
That means his appearance is not like our appearance which is subject to so many material
own spiritual identity as spirit soul we forget that whereas internal energy
means there is full enlightenment full knowledge full consciousness so the two
are totally different so in the purport Srila Prabhupada says the Asuras want to
enjoy life of sense gratification even at the cost of others happiness they
don't care for others happiness and they also don't hesitate to give trouble
to others who want to live a pious life the Asuras give trouble to such people
and they want to enjoy independently they don't care for others and Prabhupada
in order to fulfill this ambition the Asuras especially atheistic kings or
state executive heads try to equip themselves with all kinds of deadly
weapons to bring about a war in a peaceful society unnecessarily some
demoniac kings they want to declare war and somehow capture power defeat or kill
so these atheistic kings they equipped themselves with so many deadly weapons
create a condition or situation where there will be war
unnecessarily in a peaceful society there is no need for war but they will create situation that
there has to be war and mother earth because she considers all the living entities on living in
this earth planet as her own children so she feels for their suffering when the Kings oppress the
the unwanted asuras they have to be vanquished by the supreme lord only nobody else can actually
control them or curtail them or restrict their nefarious activities even the demigods the rishis
the all the different inhabitants of the upper planets
or even the the powerful persons on this earth or in the lower planets they cannot restrict these
asuras so they and the asuras unnecessarily give trouble to the devotees unless they give
trouble so therefore there is an absolute necessity of the supreme lord's appearance
and he does his duty or his
or his seva regardless of whether others are doing or not doing so he appears also for delivering all
the others and he simultaneously protects the devotees and kills the demons in the 35th verse
the meaning of this 35th verse is
who therefore can tolerate the pangs of
separation from that supreme personality of godhead
he could conquer the gravity and passionate wrath of his sweethearts like satyabhama
by his sweet smile of love pleasing glance and hearty appeals
krishna is very very very kind and benevolent towards his devotees
so for those who render loving service to him krishna is also reciprocating with such devotees
and his reciprocation is very very very very attractive
further it is said when he traversed my surface that is the earth surface i would be immersed in the dust of his lotus feet
And thus would be sumptuously covered with grass, which appeared like hair standing on me out of pleasure.
Lord was constantly in touch with the surface of this earth planet.
So Mother Earth felt the touch of the Lord's lotus feet on her body.
And she was always very much happy and ecstatic with such contact.
So it appeared like the grass that was growing whenever the Lord walked on the surface of the earth.
Those grass appeared like hair standing on the body of the earth planet
due to the contact of the Lord's lotus feet with the Mother, with the earth planet.
there were chances of separation between the Lord and his thousands of queens because of the Lord's being absent from home.
So in the daytime the Lord would go to the
in the evening He would return and spend time with His family members in His palaces.
So when he would go away, they would feel
the lord's absence from their home.
Thousands of queens, sixteen thousand one hundred and eight queens,
But as far as this connection with the earth was concerned,
The Lord would traverse the earth with his lotus feet, and therefore there was no chance of separation.
He would always travel on the earth surface.
So no chance of separation for Mother Earth from the contact with the lotus feet of the Supreme Lord Krishna when he was present on the earth.
So therefore, when the Lord left this earth planet and went back to his personal abode in the spiritual world,
Mother Earth's feelings of separation were therefore very, very, very acute, very intense.
She felt the separation so much.
Because for 125 years the Lord was there constantly.
His lotus feet was in touch with the surface of the earth.
So she felt the most, the separation from the Lord after he left for his personal abode.
tayor evam kathayato prithvi dharmayostada parikshin nama rajarshi praptaprachim sarasvatim
The meaning of this last verse, while the earth and the personality of religion were thus engaged
in conversation, the saintly king Pariksit reached the shore of the Saraswati river which flowed towards the east.
So the description is continuing that Pariksit has reached that spot where the personality of Kali was trying to beat a cow and a bull.
And then now there will be the personality of Dharma and the personality of Mother Earth were conversing with each other.
And Pariksit reached there at that time.
Now Pariksit is going to enquire and is going to take action, suitable action against the personality of Kali.
We will hear that in the next chapter.
So I will stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
